key_risks: Fee structure leading to user dissatisfaction
Regulatory and compliance risks in multiple jurisdictions
Economic sensitivity and reliance on the gig economy
High dispute resolution costs for large contracts
controversies: Excessive commission fees criticized by users
Bias toward clients in disputes harming freelancers
Prevalence of scam clients and jobs
Activist hedge fund interest pressuring strategic changes
social_issues: User dissatisfaction with fees and quality control
Ethical concerns over dispute resolution fairness
Complaints about scam clients and jobs
governance_issues: Challenges in enforcing labor laws and ethical standards

sources.title: Arbitration - Upwork Customer Service & Support | Upwork Help
sources.snippet: When you are presented with an option for arbitration, you'll find the cost in the email notification from Upwork. It is also outlined in our Fixed Price Escrow Instructions. sources.title: Dispute an agency or freelancer's hours - Upwork
sources.snippet: To be eligible to file a dispute with Upwork, clients have a five-day review period that starts from Monday at noon UTC after the billing period ends, until Friday 23:59 UTC. Unless you file a dispute within this timeline, funds are released as scheduled to the freelancer. Once funds are removed from the platform, they can no longer be recovered.

sources.title: Upwork Dispute - Advice? : r/Upwork - Reddit
sources.snippet: Upwork can't decide the dispute, all they can do is try and find a compromise. If you can afford to, stand your ground and simply insist on taking it to arbitration. The client must know that (if your account is correct) they can't win arbitration so they are not likely to take that chance and will probably back down.
